activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: mri_1 not_any: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: tms_1 tmoca_1: label: T-MoCA fields: caption_before: all_fields: | Thank you for your patience and for answering the previous questions. I am now going to ask you to do some tasks and will provide you with instructions throughout. This should take approximately 10 minutes. You will need a pencil or pen to complete this portion. Are you ready? submit: | Note to screener: The T-MoCA is performed on a paper form. When completed, enter the score here and save to continue to the next step. references: dynamic_model__ipa_ps_tmoca: from: this add: one_to_this creatable_if: <<: *enabled_if all: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: tms_1 not_any: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: tmoca_1 cognitive_screening_completed: label: Cognitive Screening Completed caption_before: all_fields: | Thank you for your patience and for answering these previous questions. Please note that we will keep this information with your research records. As I mention before, some of your responses may be shared with our Football Player Health Study staff members and you may be contacted to participate in additional research opportunities. I have recorded your answers to the questions and these will be reviewed by a study physician to determine whether you are eligible for the study. We will contact you to let you know if you are eligible. creatable_if: <<: *enabled_if all: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: tmoca_1 not_any: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: cognitive_screening_completed informant_details: label: Informant Details caption_before: all_fields: | [For those who scored <= 19 on the T-MoCA ONLY] The next step of this screening process is to speak to a close family member who knows you well or someone who can legally make decisions for you to ask them questions about your memory. For example, we will ask them to tell us if you need reminders or help with activities such as keeping track of appointments, household chores and personal care. We will also ask them to tell us about your mood – for example, if you get anxious or irritated. This will entail a brief phone call with the individual you decide to provide contact information for. Following the phone call, we will send them an individualized link via email which will contain a 23 -question survey. This survey will not contain any identifiable information – for instance, it will not contain your name, address, or birthdate and your family member will not be asked to provide this information either. Do we have your permission to speak to someone that knows you well? references: dynamic_model__ipa_ps_informant_detail: from: this add: one_to_this creatable_if: <<: *enabled_if all: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: cognitive_screening_completed dynamic_model__ipa_ps_tmocas: tmoca_score: condition: <= value: 19 not_any: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: informant_details schedule_callback: label: Schedule Callback fields: - callback_date - callback_time - notes caption_before: all_fields: | Thank you for your patience and for answering these previous questions. Please note that if you are eligible and enroll in this pilot study, we will keep this information with your research records. If you are not eligible or choose not to participate we will destroy it. I have recorded your answers to the questions and these will be reviewed by a study physician to determine whether you are eligible for the pilot study. We will then contact you to let you know if you are eligible or not. If you are eligible, we will let you know the next steps. Do you have any questions? We will call you back to inform you of your eligibility status. What is a good day/time to call you? submit: If you have any questions in the meantime, please do not hesitate to contact us. Thank you again for your time. creatable_if: <<: *enabled_if all: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: cognitive_screening_completed not_any: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: schedule_callback finalize: label: Finalize Entries caption_before: all_fields: | When finalized the phone screen forms are locked from editing. submit: | Save this entry to lock the phone screen forms and generate an inclusion/exclusion checklist record. Click the cancel button instead if review or revision of the phone screen forms is still required. creatable_if: <<: *enabled_if all: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: schedule_callback not_any: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens: extra_log_type: finalize save_action: on_create: show_panel: value: activity_log__ipa_assignment_inex_checklists hide_panel: value: activity_log__ipa_assignment_phone_screens # Override the default that hides activities after a certain stage, # so that any user can see that the phone screen process has been completed showable_if: always: true

associated_activity_logs.name: IPA Tracker
associated_activity_logs.extra_log_types:
_definitions:
  enabled_if: &enabled_if

    # if performed a phone screening no consent to continue, disable after 14 days
    not_all_not_interested:
      any:
        dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
          select_is_good_time_to_speak: not interested
          select_may_i_begin: not interested
          select_still_interested: 'no'

      all_created_at:
        dynamic_model__ipa_ps_initial_screenings:
          created_at:
            condition: <
            value: -14 days

    # if recorded a withdraw activity, disable after 14 days
    not_all_withdraw:
      any:
        dynamic_model__ipa_withdrawals:
          select_subject_withdrew_reason: withdrew
          select_investigator_terminated: 
            - yes - due to ae
            - yes - other reason
          lost_to_follow_up_no_yes: 'yes'
          no_longer_participating_no_yes: 'yes'
      all_created_at:
        dynamic_model__ipa_withdrawals:
          created_at:
            condition: <
            value: -14 days

    # if performed a screening follow up and not eligible, disable after 14 days
    not_all_ineligible:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no: 'no'
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

    # if performed a screening follow up and not interested in participating, disable after 14 days
    not_all_ps_followup_not_interested:
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        still_interested_blank_yes_no: 'no'
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days

    # if the exit survey has been completed, disable after 14 days
    not_all_complete:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: follow_up_surveys
      dynamic_model__ipa_surveys:
        select_survey_type: exit survey     
        created_at:
          condition: <
          value: -14 days


  

_default:
  view_options:
    hide_unless_creatable: true

  showable_if: *enabled_if
  creatable_if: *enabled_if
  editable_if: *enabled_if


schedule_screening:
  label: Schedule Screening
  fields: 
    - select_who
    - select_record_from_player_contacts
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    select_who: Who will perform the phone screening?
    select_record_from_player_contacts: Phone number to call
    follow_up_when: Scheduled date
    follow_up_time: Scheduled time (Eastern Time)
    notes: Additional notes for the screener    
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - screening_follow_up

  field_options:
    select_who:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_user_with_role_phone_screener
    select_record_from_player_contacts:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_record_from_player_contact_phone

  showable_if:
    always: true

screening_follow_up:
  label: Schedule Screening Follow Up
  fields: 
    - select_who
    - select_record_from_player_contacts
    - follow_up_when
    - follow_up_time
    - notes
  caption_before:
    select_who: Who will perform the phone screening follow up?
    select_record_from_player_contacts: Phone number to call
    follow_up_when: Scheduled date
    follow_up_time: Scheduled time (Eastern Time)
    notes: Additional notes
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - appointment  
  field_options:
    select_who:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_user_with_role_phone_screener
    select_record_from_player_contacts:
      edit_as:
        field_type: select_record_from_player_contact_phone

      
perform_screening_follow_up:
  label: Perform Screening Follow Up
  references:
    ipa_screening:
      from: this
      add: one_to_this
  caption_before:
    all_fields: |
      Record the eligibility of the participant and any additional notes needed to perform the phone screening follow up.
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
    not_any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: 
          - appointment

  # Always show, so we know why a player's records may be locked down
  showable_if: 
    always: true
      

appointment:
  label: Appointment
  fields:

  references:
    ipa_appointment:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: perform_screening_follow_up
      dynamic_model__ipa_screenings:
        eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no: 'yes'
        still_interested_blank_yes_no: 'yes'


contact_info:
  label: Emergency Contacts
  fields:

  references:

    emergency_contact:
      from: master
      add: many   

  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment


mrn:
  label: MRN
  fields:

  references:
    mrn_number:
      from: master
      add: many   
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment

  save_trigger:
    on_create:
      notify:
        type: email
        role: clinical research coordinator
        layout_template: ipa notification layout
        content_template: ipa message content
        subject: "IPA App: Subject MRN assigned"
 

transportation_and_housing:
  label: Transportation and Housing
  fields:
  references:
    ipa_transportation:
      from: master
      add: many
      view_as:
        new: not_embedded
        edit: not_embedded
    ipa_hotel:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
      view_as:
        new: not_embedded
        edit: not_embedded
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    all:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: appointment

consent_mailing:
  label: Consent Mailing
  fields: 
  references:
    ipa_consent_mailing:
      from: master
      add: one_to_this

payments:
  label: Payments
  fields:
  references:
    ipa_payment:
      from: master
      add: many
      limit: 2
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: screening_follow_up
    

withdraw:
  label: Withdraw
  fields:
  references:
    ipa_withdrawal:
      from: master
      add: one_to_master
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type: schedule_screening

  # Always show, so we know why a player's records may be locked down
  showable_if:
    always: true

follow_up_surveys:
  label: Follow Up Surveys
  fields: 
  references:
    ipa_survey:
      from: master
      add: many
      limit: 2
  creatable_if:
    <<: *enabled_if
    any:
      activity_log__ipa_assignments:
        extra_log_type:
          - appointment
  # Always show, so we know why a player's records may be locked down
  showable_if:
    always: true


general:
  label: General Communications
  fields:
    - select_activity

This can include a vagal nerve stimulator, deep brain stimulator, epidural/subdural stimulator, etc. neurostimulator_details: IF YES , specify the type of neurostimulator. pacemaker_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Do you have a cardiac pacemaker or intracardiac lines? med_infusion_device_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Do you have a medication infusion device? past_tms_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Did you ever undergo TMS in the past? past_tms_details: IF YES , were there any problems? Please describe. past_mri_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Did you ever undergo an MRI in the past? past_mri_details: IF YES , were there any problems? Please describe. current_meds_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Are you currently taking any medications including over the counter medications? current_meds_details: IF YES , please list them. neuro_history_details: Please list all past neurological (relating to your brain or spinal cord) medical or surgical history. other_chronic_problems_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Do you have a history of any other chronic health problems? other_chronic_problems_details: IF YES Please tell me about them hospital_visits_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Have you experienced any hospitalizations or emergency room visits in the last six months? hospital_visits_details: IF YES Please tell me what happened dietary_restrictions_blank_yes_no_dont_know: Do you have any dietary restrictions or allergies? dietary_restrictions_details: IF YES Could you tell me what dietary restrictions/allergies you have? anything_else_blank_yes_no: Is there anything else that you want to tell me about? anything_else_details: IF YES Please tell me

associated_reports.name: Search IPA Subject
associated_reports.description:
Search subjects by name, phone, email or ID.
Leave the search field empty to see all subjects.
associated_reports.sql:
select distinct m.id master_id, 
pi.first_name, pi.middle_name, pi.last_name, pi.nick_name,
a.street, a.street2, a.city, a.state, a.zip, 
pc.data, pc.rec_type
from masters m
inner join player_infos pi
on pi.master_id = m.id 
inner join ipa_assignments b
on m.id = b.master_id
left join addresses a
on m.id = a.master_id
left join player_contacts pc
on pc.master_id = m.id
where 
(:name is null 
or pi.first_name ~* :name
or pi.last_name ~* :name
or pi.middle_name ~* :name
or pi.nick_name ~* :name
or( 
    pi.first_name ~* coalesce(split_part(:name, ' ', 1),'none')
    AND pi.last_name ~* coalesce(split_part(:name, ' ', 2),'none')
  )
) OR
(
regexp_replace(pc.data, '\W+', '', 'g') ~* regexp_replace(:name, '\W+', '', 'g')
) OR
(
b.ipa_id::varchar = :name
)
associated_reports.search_attrs:
name: 
  text: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

associated_reports.name: IPA Protocol Deviation PI Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring review by the PI.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.*,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_protocol_deviations p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 INNER JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'deviation_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type in ('pi_review', 'initial_review')
 AND p.select_severity = 'major'


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type = 'initial_review'
AND
  r = 1 AND dt.extra_log_type <> 'pi_review'

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Event PI Review
associated_reports.description: IPA records requiring review by the PI.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id

FROM (
 SELECT a2.*,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 INNER JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id

 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 
 AND a2.extra_log_type in ('pi_review', 'initial_review')
 AND p.select_relatedness IN ('related', 'possibly related') AND p.select_expectedness = 'unexpected'
 AND (p.select_location = 'internal' OR p.select_severity = 'serious')


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE
  r >= 1 AND dt.extra_log_type = 'initial_review'
AND
  r = 1 AND dt.extra_log_type <> 'pi_review'

ORDER BY

;

associated_reports.name: IPA Appointments
associated_reports.sql:
select ap.master_id, pi.first_name, pi.last_name, visit_start_date, select_navigator, max(ap.id) from ipa_appointments ap
inner join activity_log_ipa_assignments al
on al.master_id = ap.master_id

inner join player_infos pi
on ap.master_id = pi.master_id

where 
(:from_date IS NULL OR :from_date <= now())
AND
(:to_date IS NULL OR :to_date >= now())
GROUP BY
ap.master_id, visit_start_date, select_navigator, pi.first_name, pi.last_name
ORDER BY visit_start_date asc
;

  date:

to_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

associated_reports.name: IPA Outstanding Activities
associated_reports.description: Search for records where one activity has been performed and another hasn't been performed after it (optional).
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
   dt.master_id,
   pi.first_name,
   pi.last_name,
   dt.source,
   dt.extra_log_type activity,
   dt.communication_result,
   dt.checklist_signed,
   dt.created_at,
   dt.r
FROM (

  SELECT
    di.*,
    rank()
    OVER (
    PARTITION BY di.master_id 
    ORDER BY di.created_at DESC
    ) AS r
  FROM  
  (
    SELECT      
      al.master_id,
      'tracker' "source",
      al.extra_log_type,
      al.select_result "communication_result",
      NULL "checklist_signed",
      al.created_at
      
    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al
    
    WHERE
    :activity_performed = 'general-follow-up' AND al.extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='follow up'
    OR
    :activity_performed = 'general-completed' AND al.extra_log_type='general' AND select_result='completed'
    OR
    :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-follow-up' AND al.extra_log_type='general' 
    OR
    :activity_outstanding is not null AND :activity_outstanding = 'general-completed' AND al.extra_log_type='general' 
    OR
    al.extra_log_type IN (:activity_performed, :activity_outstanding)

    UNION

    SELECT      
      inex.master_id,
      'inex' "source",
      inex.extra_log_type,
      NULL "communication_result",
      inex.signed_no_yes "checklist_signed",
      inex.created_at
      

    FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_inex_checklists inex
    WHERE
        
    (:activity_performed = 'inex-complete' OR :activity_outstanding IS NOT NULL AND :activity_outstanding  = 'inex-complete' )
    AND extra_log_type IN ('sign_phone_screen_staff', 'sign_baseline_staff') 
    

      
  ) AS di

) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id

WHERE
(:activity_outstanding IS NULL OR :activity_outstanding IS NOT NULL AND r = 1)
AND 
( 
  
  :activity_performed = 'general-follow-up' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='follow up'
  OR
    :activity_performed = 'general-completed' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='completed'
  OR (   
    :activity_performed = 'inex-complete'
    AND (
      dt.extra_log_type IN ('sign_phone_screen_staff', 'sign_baseline_staff') AND
      checklist_signed = 'yes'
    )
  )  
  OR :activity_performed <> 'inex-complete' AND dt.extra_log_type = :activity_performed 
)
AND (
  :activity_outstanding IS NULL 
  OR NOT (
    r = 1
    AND (
      :activity_outstanding = 'general-follow-up' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='follow up'
      OR :activity_outstanding = 'general-completed' AND dt.extra_log_type='general' AND dt.communication_result='completed'
      OR (
          :activity_outstanding = 'inex-complete'
          AND (
            dt.extra_log_type IN ('sign_phone_screen_staff', 'sign_baseline_staff') AND
            checklist_signed = 'yes'
          )
      )
      OR :activity_outstanding <> 'inex-complete' AND dt.extra_log_type = :activity_outstanding
    )
  )

)
ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
activity_performed: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: general-follow-up
    selections:
      general communication - follow-up: general-follow-up
      general communication - completed: general-completed
      scheduled screening: schedule_screening
      payment made: payments
      inclusion/exclusion screening complete: inex-complete
      scheduled screening follow-up: screening_follow_up
      performed screening follow-up: perform_screening_follow_up
      set appointment: appointment
      added emergency contacts: contact_info
      transportation and housing: transportation_and_housing
      consent mailing: consent_mailing
      follow up surveys: follow_up_surveys
      withdraw: withdraw


activity_outstanding: 
  config_selector: 
    label: Activity outstanding (optional)
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: general-completed
    selections:
      general communication - follow-up: general-follow-up
      general communication - completed: general-completed
      scheduled screening: schedule_screening
      payment made: payments
      inclusion/exclusion screening complete: inex-complete
      scheduled screening follow-up: screening_follow_up
      performed screening follow-up: perform_screening_follow_up
      set appointment: appointment
      added emergency contacts: contact_info
      transportation and housing: transportation_and_housing
      consent mailing: consent_mailing
      follow up surveys: follow_up_surveys
      withdraw: withdraw

   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON

 ON

associated_reports.name: IPA Adverse Events
associated_reports.description:
IPA Adverse Events report for fast review of events requiring additional action or for summary reporting.

The activities are performed in this order: initial submission, initial review, PI review (if required), report to IRB (if PI review was required)

NOTE: the Last Activity Performed represents the last recorded activity for a specific adverse event. Therefore to find outstanding tasks, for example items requiring Report to IRB, it is necessary to search for the last activity that was performed, PI Review in this example.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id,
coalesce(dt.created_at, dt.submitted_at) "last activity",
coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') "Last Activity Performed",
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
select_severity, select_location, select_relatedness, select_expectedness, event_occurred_when, event_discovered_when,
dt.primary_extra_log_type,
dt.primary_activity
FROM (
 SELECT a.master_id , a.id "primary_activity", a.extra_log_type "primary_extra_log_type", a.created_at "submitted_at", a2.created_at, a2.extra_log_type, p.select_severity, p.select_location, p.select_relatedness, p.select_expectedness,
   p.event_occurred_when, p.event_discovered_when,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_adverse_events p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_adverse_events a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentAdverseEvent'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id


 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'adverse_event_record' 


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE r = 1 
AND (:event_occurred_from IS NULL OR event_occurred_when >= :event_occurred_from)
AND (:event_occurred_to IS NULL OR event_occurred_when <= :event_occurred_to)
AND (:severity IS NULL OR select_severity = :severity)
AND (:location IS NULL OR select_location = :location)
AND ((:relatedness) IS NULL OR select_relatedness IN (:relatedness))
AND ((:expectedness) IS NULL OR select_expectedness = (:expectedness))
AND ((:latest_activity) IS NULL OR coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') IN (:latest_activity))

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
severity: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_severity
    multiple: single
    default: serious
location: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_location
    multiple: single

relatedness: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_relatedness
    multiple: multiple
    default: 
      - related
      - possibly related

expectedness: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_adverse_events_select_expectedness
    multiple: single

event_occurred_from: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: -15 days
event_occurred_to: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
latest_activity: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: multiple
    label: Latest Activity Performed
    selections: 
      initial submission: initial submission
      initial review: initial_review
      pi review: pi_review
      report to irb: report_to_irb

associated_reports.name: IPA In Process & Exited
associated_reports.description: All subjects that have joined or exited the study: in process (phone screening scheduled), completed, withdrawn, ineligible, not interested (during phone screen or follow-up)
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT * from (
SELECT distinct dt.master_id, 
CASE 
WHEN extra_log_type = 'follow_up_surveys' THEN 'completed'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'withdraw' THEN 'withdrawn'
WHEN ps_interested1 = 'not interested' OR ps_interested2 = 'not interested' OR ps_still_interested = 'no'
  THEN 'not interest during phone screening'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'perform_screening_follow_up' AND eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no = 'no'
  THEN 'ineligible'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'perform_screening_follow_up' AND follow_up_still_interested = 'no'
  THEN 'not interest during screening follow-up'
WHEN extra_log_type = 'schedule_screening' THEN 'in process'
ELSE extra_log_type
END "status", 
pi.first_name, pi.last_name ,
dt.created_at "when"
-- , ps_interested1, ps_interested2, ps_still_interested
FROM 
(
SELECT
al.master_id, al.created_at, al.extra_log_type,
ipa_screenings.eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no, ipa_screenings.still_interested_blank_yes_no "follow_up_still_interested", 
ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_is_good_time_to_speak "ps_interested1",
ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_may_i_begin "ps_interested2",
ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_still_interested "ps_still_interested",
rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY al.master_id 
  ORDER BY al.created_at DESC
 ) AS r

FROM activity_log_ipa_assignments al
LEFT JOIN ipa_screenings
ON al.master_id = ipa_screenings.master_id
LEFT JOIN ipa_surveys
ON al.master_id = ipa_surveys.master_id
LEFT JOIN ipa_ps_initial_screenings
ON al.master_id = ipa_ps_initial_screenings.master_id
WHERE
(
(
  ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_is_good_time_to_speak = 'not interested' 
  OR ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_may_i_begin = 'not interested'
  OR ipa_ps_initial_screenings.select_still_interested = 'no'
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'perform_screening_follow_up'
  AND ( 
    ipa_screenings.eligible_for_study_blank_yes_no = 'no'
    OR ipa_screenings.still_interested_blank_yes_no = 'no'
  )
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'follow_up_surveys'
  AND ipa_surveys.select_survey_type = 'exit survey'
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'withdraw'
)
OR
(
  extra_log_type = 'schedule_screening'
)
)
) dt
INNER JOIN player_infos pi
ON dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE r = 1 
) dt2
WHERE status IN(:select_status)
ORDER BY status, "when" desc
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
select_status: 
  config_selector:
    label: Select / de-select statuses to report  
    all: true
    multiple: multiple
    default: 
      - ineligible
      - completed
      - withdrawn
      - in process
      - not interest during phone screening
      - not interest during screening follow-up
    selections: 
      ineligible: ineligible
      completed: completed
      withdrawn: withdrawn
      in process: in process
      not interest during phone screening: not interest during phone screening
      not interest during screening follow-up: not interest during screening follow-up

associated_reports.name: IPA Navigation Events
associated_reports.sql:
select pi.master_id, pi.first_name, pi.last_name, ipa.ipa_id, 
al.extra_log_type "type",
al.select_status "status",
al.select_station "station",
al.select_event_type "event type",
al.other_event_type "other event type",
al.event_date,
al.start_time,
al.completion_time,
al.arrival_time

from activity_log_ipa_assignment_navigations al
inner join player_infos pi
on pi.master_id = al.master_id
inner join ipa_assignments ipa
on ipa.master_id = al.master_id
where
(:from_date IS NULL or event_date >= :from_date)
AND ((:type) IS NULL or extra_log_type in (:type))
AND ((:confirmed) IS NULL or select_status in (:confirmed))
AND ((:station) IS NULL or select_station in (:station))
AND (:ipa_id IS NULL or ipa.ipa_id = :ipa_id);
associated_reports.search_attrs:
from_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

type: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: multiple
    selections: 
      planned: planned_event
      station event: station_event
      general event: general_event
    default: 
      - planned_event

confirmed: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: activity_log__ipa_assignment_navigation_select_status
    multiple: multiple
    default: 
      - unconfirmed


station: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: activity_log__ipa_assignment_navigation_select_station
    multiple: multiple
ipa_id: 
  number: 
    label: IPA ID
    all: true
    multiple: single

associated_reports.name: IPA Protocol Deviations
associated_reports.description:
IPA Protocol Deviations report for fast review of events requiring additional action or for summary reporting.

The activities are performed in this order: initial submission, initial review, PI review (if required), report to IRB (if PI review was required)

NOTE: the Last Activity Performed represents the last recorded activity for a specific protocol deviations. Therefore to find outstanding tasks, for example items requiring Report to IRB, it is necessary to search for the last activity that was performed, PI Review in this example.
associated_reports.sql:
SELECT 
dt.master_id,
coalesce(dt.created_at, dt.submitted_at) "last activity",
coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') "Last Activity Performed",
pi.first_name,
pi.last_name,
select_severity, deviation_occurred_when, deviation_discovered_when,
dt.primary_extra_log_type,
dt.primary_activity
FROM (
 SELECT a.master_id , a.id "primary_activity", a.extra_log_type "primary_extra_log_type", a.created_at "submitted_at", a2.created_at, a2.extra_log_type, p.select_severity, 
   p.deviation_occurred_when, p.deviation_discovered_when,
   rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.id
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC, a2.created_at DESC
 ) AS r
 FROM activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a

 INNER JOIN model_references mr
 ON
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id

 INNER JOIN ipa_protocol_deviations p
 ON 
   mr.to_record_type = 'DynamicModel::IpaProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr.to_record_id = p.id

 LEFT JOIN model_references mr2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id

 LEFT JOIN activity_log_ipa_assignment_protocol_deviations a2
 ON
   mr2.from_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.to_record_type = 'ActivityLog::IpaAssignmentProtocolDeviation'
   AND mr2.from_record_id = a.id
   AND mr2.to_record_id = a2.id


 WHERE 
 a.extra_log_type = 'deviation_record' 


) AS dt

inner join player_infos pi on dt.master_id = pi.master_id
WHERE 
r = 1 
AND (:deviation_occurred_from IS NULL OR deviation_occurred_when >= :deviation_occurred_from)
AND (:deviation_occurred_to IS NULL OR deviation_occurred_when <= :deviation_occurred_to)
AND (:severity IS NULL OR select_severity = :severity)
AND ((:latest_activity) IS NULL OR coalesce(dt.extra_log_type, 'initial submission') IN (:latest_activity))

ORDER BY
  dt.created_at DESC
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
severity: 
  general_selection: 
    item_type: dynamic_model__ipa_protocol_deviations_select_severity
    multiple: single
    default: serious

deviation_occurred_from: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: -15 days
deviation_occurred_to: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single

latest_activity: 
  config_selector: 
    all: true
    multiple: multiple
    label: Latest Activity Performed
    selections: 
      initial submission: initial submission
      initial review: initial_review
      pi review: pi_review
      report to irb: report_to_irb
    default:
      - pi_review

associated_reports.name: IPA Scheduled Calls
associated_reports.sql:
select 
dt.master_id, 
dt.extra_log_type "type",
dt.select_who "user to perform interview",
dt.follow_up_when "scheduled date",
dt.follow_up_time "time",
p.last_name, p.first_name,
dt.notes 
from 
(
select a.master_id, 
a.extra_log_type,
a.select_who,
a.follow_up_when,
a.follow_up_time,
a.notes,
rank()
 OVER (
  PARTITION BY a.master_id 
  ORDER BY a.created_at DESC
 ) AS r

from activity_log_ipa_assignments a
where follow_up_when >= :from_date
and extra_log_type <> 'general'
and (
  :to_date is null or follow_up_when <= :to_date
)
) dt
inner join player_infos p
on dt.master_id = p.master_id
WHERE r = 1 
order by follow_up_when asc, follow_up_time asc
;
associated_reports.search_attrs:
from_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: now

to_date: 
  date: 
    all: true
    multiple: single
    default: now

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro
associated_message_templates.template:
Hello, may I please speak to Mr. {{player_info.last_name}}?

My name is XX, and I am calling (or following up) from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University. Thank you for your interest in our research study to conduct an in-person health assessment to learn more about the long-term health effects of a career in professional football.

Is this a good time to speak?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro 2
associated_message_templates.template:
As you may know, The Football Players Health Study is a research study dedicated to understanding the current health and well-being of former NFL players. We are currently conducting in-person health assessments to learn more about the long-term health effects of a career in professional football.

Would you be willing to answer questions about your health and medical history to find out if you might qualify for the study? There are some questions about sensitive medical information involved and some of the questions may make you feel uncomfortable. I will also be asking you to do some tasks in order to assess your attention and memory such as repeating sentences or numbers back to me. You can stop at any time.

I will record your answers on a secure platform, and we will keep these answers even if you decide that you don’t want to continue in the study. This information will be stored in our secure database and may be combined with other information from other Football Players Health Studies that you have been involved in. If you do qualify for this study, we will collect detailed information to schedule your visit such as your date of birth, insurance information, an emergency contact, social security number, and address. This information will be discarded if you decide that you don’t want to be in this study. The risk of allowing us to collect and record your name with your answers is a loss of confidentiality. We will take reasonable steps to protect the confidentiality of your information.

You will receive a $20 gift card for your time today learning about the study and answering some questions about your health and medical history. This call should take about 45 minutes of your time. May I begin?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro 3
associated_message_templates.template:
Participation in this study will involve a 2 ½ day study visit in Boston that includes assessments of pain and physical function, memory and cognition (how people think and problem solve), sleep, heart function, and brain imaging. One night you will sleep in the Massachusetts General Hospital’s Clinical Research Center to complete an overnight sleep study. All other nights will be spent in a local hotel. The visits will take place at Massachusetts General Hospital’s (MGH) main campus, in the Charlestown Navy Yard in MGH facilities, at Brigham and Women’s Hospital, and at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center. All transportation, meal and lodging costs will be covered by the Study.

This comprehensive evaluation of former professional football players will help to advance our understanding of the complex and inter-related biological pathways that underline the development of player-related illnesses and disability. By participating in this research study, you will not only be helping us better understand player health and well-being, but you will also have the opportunity to learn more about yourself. Participants will be provided with results from the clinical assessments at the end of the study free of cost. At the participant’s request, these clinical results can be shared with your health care provider for further guidance and interpretation.

I am going to go over the study in some more detail. Do you have any questions so far?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro 4
associated_message_templates.template:
As I stated earlier, the testing will occur over 2 ½ days. You will be provided a detailed schedule before you come if you choose to participate.

Throughout the study, a member of the study team will guide you through the visit to make sure that you get to all of the testing and to help you with any questions that you have throughout the study. They will also ensure that you have breaks and meals throughout the days.

INTERVIEWER: HAVE THE CONSENT FORM ON HAND TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DETAILS ABOUT THE STUDY VISITS AS NEEDED.

Day 0

Upon your arrival in Boston, a study navigator will greet you and welcome you to the study. They will go over the schedule for the following day and set a meeting time for the morning. This night will be spent in a local hotel.

Day 1

The study navigator will pick you up from your hotel in the morning and take you to the Massachusetts General Hospital’s Clinical Research Center for the consent process and the baseline assessment. You will meet with a study coordinator and the study physician in order to review the study assessments and the consent form. During this time, you will be able to ask any questions or voice any concerns you may have. Once you are consented, you will get your blood drawn. Please note that will ask that you do not eat for at least 8 hours prior to this blood draw – we will be sure to remind you when you arrive. You will have breakfast following the baseline assessment. During the baseline visit you will:

  • Undergo an assessment of your health such as a review of your medical history, medications, and a brief physical exam that includes body composition measures (e.g. height, weight, waist size…)
  • Fill out some questionnaires about your health
  • Undergo a DEXA scan. A DEXA scan is a scan that ultimately looks at your bone density and body composition. There is minimal radiation and is completely non-invasive. This scan takes about 30 minutes to complete.

During the afternoon of day 1 the following assessments will follow:

  • Positron Emission Tomography (PET) with Computed Tomography (CT) – PET/CT scans take pictures of what is going on inside the body using special dyes with radiation that “light up” inside the body to make a picture. The scanner is shaped like a big ring and you will be positioned on your back on the scanner table. The table may move forward and backward as part of the testing the procedures. You will complete 2 different PET scans.
  • Sense of smell testing – This brief test consists of breathing different odors from a small handheld odor delivery device and being asked questions about your familiarity, memory and ability to name each odor.
  • Sensory testing – An assessment that consists of tests to measure your sensory responses – for example, having pressure applied to different parts of your body or putting you hand in ice water – you will be asked to report when these sensations are uncomfortable. This assessment should take approximately 30 minutes to complete.

Day 2

On the second full study day, a study staff will begin by reviewing the consent form again with you. The following assessments will follow:

  • Neuropsychological testing – An assessment that consists of tests that evaluate your mood, memory and how you think, learn and solve problems. This will be conducted with a trained neuropsychologist and should take around 2.5 hours to complete.
  • Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of your brain and liver – This is a scan that takes pictures of your brain and liver using a large magnet and radio signals. This scan is non-invasive and should take around 1.5 hours to complete.
  • Physical function testing – Testing that consists of a series of tests such as lifting weights, a timed walking test, walking upstairs carrying weights, walking while doing another task (simple math), and testing your balance. These assessments will be administered and overseen by a trained exercise physiologist and will take 2 hours to complete.
  • Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) and Electroencephalogram (EEG) – The TMS will measure brain plasticity. Brain plasticity is the ability of the brain to change and learn through experience. TMS is a noninvasive way of stimulating the brain. TMS uses a magnetic field to cause activity in the brain. The magnetic field is produced by a coil that is held next to your scalp. In this study, we will use TMS to create activity in your brain and will measure your brain’s response to the activity. This is how we measure brain plasticity. During the TMS assessment, you will have a series of electrodes (small round discs) will be placed on your head and your brain waves will be measures while you sit quietly and then while you complete a few simple tasks on a computer. This assessment is 3.5 hours long.
  • Sleep study - During the second night, you will have a sleep study in the Clinical Research Center at Massachusetts General Hospital. This will include having sensors placed on your body to monitor your movement, heart rate, breathing and brain waves while you sleep. A trained technician will assist you in placing various sensors on your body. Additionally, you will be asked to complete several questionnaires on your sleep habits.

Day 3

On the third study day, you will undergo the following assessments:

  • Oral glucose tolerance test (GTT) – This assessment includes having an IV place in your arm in order to draw blood samples. You will be asked to drink a liquid which will help us understand you blood sugar levels. This will be done in the MGH Clinical Research Center.
  • Cardiac testing – This testing consists of activities such as having pictures taken of your heart (ultrasound), assessment of your resting metabolic rate which will include you having to wear light headgear with a breathing tube, and a bicycle exercise test.
  • X-rays – You will undergo an X-ray exam, where you will be asked several questions, prepped and asked to stand in the equipment for the duration of the scan. This assessment should take no more than 15 minutes.

INTERVIEWER: OFFER TO SEND THE SUBJECT STUDY SUMMARY, CONSENT FORM, AND CONSENT FORM SUPPLEMENTS THROUGHOUT.

Are you still interested in hearing more about the study or do you have any additional questions? (offer to mail materials and call them back if they want to review materials; offer to send them a link to the IPA webpage)

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call eligible 1
associated_message_templates.template:
The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. It has been determined that you are eligible for our study. At this time, I would like to review the details about the study.

The study will take place at multiple hospitals in the Boston area over 2 ½ days with overnight stays at a local hotel and in the MGH Clinical Research Center. Each day will consist of different assessments. You will be provided with your personal study visit schedule ahead of your visit. You will be given breaks and meals throughout the days.

You will be assigned a study navigator, a member of the Football Players Health Study staff, who will accompany you throughout each day of the study. The navigator will assure that you get to each assessment. They will also handle scheduling issues or conflicts and provide assistance and act as a resource to you throughout the study.

Your mornings will begin between 5-7am and will end around 6-7pm, depending on the schedule for that particular day. Each day will begin with a review of that day’s schedule and any questions you may have will be answered. Each day will end with a review of how the procedures went. We may contact you after you complete the study visit with additional questions and follow-up.

On the day that you arrive, a study navigator will greet you. The following day, a study physician will review the consent form with you and help to answer any questions that you have. A nurse practitioner will conduct a baseline physical exam and collect information about your health and medical history. Over the next two and a half days, you will undergo assessments such as PET/CT scans, sense of smell test, neuropsychological testing, MRI scans, physical function assessments, TMS and EEG, an overnight sleep study, cardiac testing, pain assessments, and an X-ray exam.

You will be compensated up to $1800 for your time and efforts involved in participating in this pilot study. In order to pay you, you will need to provide your Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN). Your payment will be processed 30 days after the study visit. You will need to fill out a W9 and any other pertinent tax information in order to receive payment.

We will also cover the costs of your transportation, parking, lodging and meals during the study visit.

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call intro
associated_message_templates.template:
Hello, may I please speak to Mr. {{player_info.last_name}}?

My name is XX, and I am calling (or following up) from the Football Players Health Study at Harvard University in regards to our in-person assessment. Is this a good time to speak?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call eligible 2
associated_message_templates.template:
Thank you for your time today.

We will send you additional study information to review and will also be contacting you in order to schedule your study visit in Boston.

Please feel free to contact us at any time should you have any questions.

END CALL

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call not eligible
associated_message_templates.template:
The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. Based on the study criteria, you are not eligible to participate in the in-person assessments study. As a reminder, simply because you are not eligible for this particular study does not mean that you are not eligible for other Football Players Health Study research opportunities. Please check out our website footballplayershealth.harvard.edu to see what other research opportunities are currently available to you. Also, a study staff member may reach out to you in the future to inquire about your interest to participate in other studies. If you have any questions about this study or would like to discuss it further in the future, please feel free to contact us. You will be receiving a gift card for taking the time to answer our questions. Thank you very much for your time.

Confirm contact information and END CALL.

associated_message_templates.name: ipa ps intro 5
associated_message_templates.template: We would like to provide you with a $20 gift card for your time today learning about the study and answering some questions about your health and medical history. Could you please provide me with and/or confirm your contact information so that I can send you this?

associated_message_templates.name: ipa eligibility call needs partner
associated_message_templates.template:
If study subject meets eligibility criteria BUT is required to bring study partner

The Football Players Health Study at Harvard University appreciates your interest in participating in this study. It has been determined that you are eligible for our study, but we request that in order to participate, you bring a study partner with you to Boston. This partner can be a legally authorized representative, your spouse, your adult child, your adult sibling, or your parent. The Study will cover all transportation and lodging costs for your study partner for the duration of the 2 ½ days. Do you have any questions?

If subject no longer wants to participate - thank them for their time, remind them they can participate in other FPHS research studies, and end call.

At this time, I would like to review the details of the study.

The study will take place at multiple hospitals in the Boston area over 2 ½ days with overnight stays at a local hotel and in the MGH Clinical Research Center. Each day will consist of different assessments. You will be provided with your personal study visit schedule ahead of your visit. You will be given breaks and meals throughout the days.

You will be assigned a study navigator, a member of the Football Players Health Study staff, who will accompany you throughout each day of the study. The navigator will assure that you get to each assessment. They will also handle scheduling issues or conflicts and provide assistance and act as a resource to you throughout the study.

Your mornings will begin between 5-7am and will end around 6-7pm, depending on the schedule for that particular day. Each day will begin with a review of that day’s schedule and any questions you may have will be answered. Each day will end with a review of how the procedures went. We may contact you after you complete the study visit with additional questions and follow-up.

On the day that you arrive, a study navigator will greet you. The following day, a study physician will review the consent form with you and help to answer any questions that you have. A nurse practitioner will conduct a baseline physical exam and collect information about your health and medical history. Over the next two and a half days, you will undergo assessments such as PET/CT scans, sense of smell test, neuropsychological testing, MRI scans, physical function assessments, TMS and EEG, an overnight sleep study, cardiac testing, pain assessments, and an X-ray exam.

You will be compensated up to $1800 for your time and efforts involved in participating in this pilot study. In order to pay you, you will need to provide your Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN). Your payment will be processed 30 days after the study visit. You will need to fill out a W9 and any other pertinent tax information in order to receive payment.

We will also cover the costs of your transportation, parking, lodging and meals during the study visit.
